CHAT.comment: Chi begins to write as Mot flips through the book. She Throughout the letter writing process , MOT spells out words for Chi , because she says that Chi isn't able to hear or sound out the spellings of the words. Mot gives Chi suggestions on the content of the letter , and Chi chooses to offer the author ideas for his next book. There seems to be quite a bit of guidance in terms of spelling and punctuation from Mot to Chi , but Chi ultimately decides what he wants to write and does so pretty independently.

u.a: MOT puts down pencil , Chi continues to write
SIS answers back about looking for something .
Chi looks to the calendar for the date
SIS needs markers or crayons and there is a bit of a disruption while EXP gives markers to the other child . Chi continues to write .
the other child has returned and is talking to EXP
reminding Chi to capitalize the next word after a period
asking for Mot's help in spelling the word
aft sounds of erasing and writing
trying to hold in her laughter
Chi has written <send it to my> instead of <to me>
